title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement [INSERT CONTACT METHOD]. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/ code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https:// www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Athanasia Mo Mowinckel. Author, maintainer. Herve Lemaitre. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Mowinckel (2026). ggsegAAL: AAL Atlases 'ggseg' Ecosystem. R package version 2.0.0, https://github.com/ggsegverse/ggsegAal.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ggsegAAL: AAL Atlases for the 'ggseg' Ecosystem},   author = {Athanasia Mo Mowinckel},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 2.0.0},   url = {https://github.com/ggsegverse/ggsegAal}, }

what: Quick instructions for AI coding agents working on ggsegAAL
title: Quick instructions for AI coding agents working on ggsegAAL
text: ggseg 2.0 atlas package providing brain atlas data ggseg ecosystem. data-package custom functions.

title: Quick instructions for AI coding agents working on ggsegAAL
text: aal2 – AAL2 cortical atlas (41 regions/hemisphere, Rolls et al. 2015) aal3_cortical – AAL3 cortical atlas (45 regions/hemisphere, Rolls et al. 2020) aal3_subcortical – AAL3 basal ganglia/thalamus (22 regions) aal3_cerebellum – AAL3 cerebellum (17 regions)

title: Quick instructions for AI coding agents working on ggsegAAL
text: data/*.rda – Unified ggseg_atlas objects (2D + 3D one object) R/data.R – Roxygen2 documentation atlas R/ggsegAal-package.R – Package-level docs, imports ggseg.formats data-raw/ – Scripts generated/converted atlas data

title: Quick instructions for AI coding agents working on ggsegAAL
text: package depends ggseg.formats provides ggseg_atlas class. atlas objects work ggseg::geom_brain() (2D) ggseg3d::ggseg3d() (3D).

title: Quick instructions for AI coding agents working on ggsegAAL
text: Update docs: devtools::document() Run tests: devtools::test() (testthat edition 3, describe/style) Full check: devtools::check() Build pkgdown site: pkgdown::build_site()

title: Quick instructions for AI coding agents working on ggsegAAL
text: code comments except necessary workarounds Roxygen2 markdown enabled Tests use describe/BDD style vdiffr visual regression URLs point ggseg GitHub org (LCBC-UiO)

what: AAL Atlases for the ggseg Ecosystem
title: AAL Atlases for the ggseg Ecosystem
text: package contains AAL (Automated Anatomical Labeling) atlas ggseg ggseg3d plotting packages. template files obtained faskowit/multiAtlasTT. Rolls, E. T., Joliot, M., & Tzourio-Mazoyer, N. (2015). Implementation new parcellation orbitofrontal cortex automated anatomical labeling atlas. Neuroimage, 122, 1-5.

title: AAL Atlases for the ggseg Ecosystem
text: recommend installing ggseg-atlases ggseg r-universe: can install ggsegAal GitHub :
code: options(repos = c(   ggseg = "https://ggseg.r-universe.dev",   CRAN = "https://cloud.r-project.org" ))  install.packages("ggsegAal") # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("ggseg/ggsegAal")

title: AAL Atlases for the ggseg Ecosystem
text: Please note ‘ggsegAal’ project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.
code: library(ggsegAAL) library(ggseg) library(ggplot2)  ggplot() +   geom_brain(     atlas = aal(),     mapping = aes(fill = label),     position = position_brain(hemi ~ view),     show.legend = FALSE   ) +   scale_fill_manual(values = aal()$palette, na.value = "grey") +   theme_void() library(ggseg3d)  ggseg3d(atlas = aal()) |>   pan_camera("right lateral")

title: AAL Cortical Atlas — aal
text: Brain atlas original Automated Anatomical Labeling parcellation (Tzourio-Mazoyer et al. 2002).

title: AAL Cortical Atlas — aal
text: ggseg.formats::ggseg_atlas object (cortical).

title: AAL Cortical Atlas — aal
text: Tzourio-Mazoyer N, Landeau B, Papathanassiou D, et al. (2002). Automated Anatomical Labeling Activations SPM Using Macroscopic Anatomical Parcellation MNI MRI Single-Subject Brain. NeuroImage, 15(1):273-289. doi:10.1006/nimg.2001.0978

title: AAL Cortical Atlas — aal
code: aal() #>  #> ── aal ggseg atlas ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Type: cortical #> Regions: 82 #> Hemispheres: left, right #> Views: inferior, lateral, medial, title: AAL2 Cortical Atlas — aal2
text: Brain atlas AAL2 parcellation (Rolls et al. 2015) 41 cortical regions per hemisphere. Contains 2D polygon geometry ggseg::geom_brain() 3D vertex indices ggseg3d::ggseg3d().

title: AAL2 Cortical Atlas — aal2
text: ggseg.formats::ggseg_atlas object (cortical).

title: AAL2 Cortical Atlas — aal2
text: Region names confirmed Herve Lemaitre (AAL2 co-author), mapping original generic annotation labels anatomical AAL2 names.

title: AAL2 Cortical Atlas — aal2
text: Rolls, E. T., Joliot, M., & Tzourio-Mazoyer, N. (2015). Implementation new parcellation orbitofrontal cortex automated anatomical labeling atlas. Neuroimage, 122, 1-5. (PubMed)

title: AAL2 Cortical Atlas — aal2
code: aal2() #>  #> ── aal2 ggseg atlas ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Type: cortical #> Regions: 41 #> Hemispheres: left, right #> Views: inferior, lateral, medial, title: AAL3 Cerebellum Atlas — aal3_cerebellum
text: Cerebellar parcellation AAL3 (Rolls et al. 2020) 17 regions including bilateral lobules midline vermis. Contains 2D polygon geometry ggseg::geom_brain() 3D meshes ggseg3d::ggseg3d().

title: AAL3 Cerebellum Atlas — aal3_cerebellum
text: ggseg.formats::ggseg_atlas object (subcortical).

title: AAL3 Cerebellum Atlas — aal3_cerebellum
text: Rolls, E. T., Huang, C. C., Lin, C. P., Feng, J., & Joliot, M. (2020). Automated anatomical labelling atlas 3. Neuroimage, 206, 116189. (PubMed)

title: AAL3 Cerebellum Atlas — aal3_cerebellum
code: aal3_cerebellum() #>  #> ── aal3_cerebellum ggseg atlas ───────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Type: subcortical #> Regions: 17 #> Hemispheres: left, right, middle #> Views: coronal, axial, sagittal #> Palette: ✔ #> Rendering: ✔ ggseg #> ✔ ggseg3d (meshes) #> ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> # A tibble: 26 × 3 #>    hemi   region           label                  #>    <chr>  <chr>            <chr>                  #>  1 left   cerebellum crus1 Cerebellum_Crus1_left  #>  2 right  cerebellum crus1 Cerebellum_Crus1_right #>  3 left   cerebellum crus2 Cerebellum_Crus2_left  #>  4 right  cerebellum crus2 Cerebellum_Crus2_right #>  5 left   cerebellum 3     Cerebellum_3_left      #>  6 right  cerebellum 3     Cerebellum_3_right     #>  7 left   cerebellum 4 5   Cerebellum_4_5_left    #>  8 right  cerebellum 4 5   Cerebellum_4_5_right   #>  9 left   cerebellum 6     Cerebellum_6_left      #> 10 right  cerebellum 6     Cerebellum_6_right     #> 11 left   cerebellum 7b    Cerebellum_7b_left     #> 12 right  cerebellum 7b    Cerebellum_7b_right    #> 13 left   cerebellum 8     Cerebellum_8_left      #> 14 right  cerebellum 8     Cerebellum_8_right     #> 15 left   cerebellum 9     Cerebellum_9_left      #> 16 right  cerebellum 9     Cerebellum_9_right     #> 17 left   cerebellum 10    Cerebellum_10_left     #> 18 right  cerebellum 10    Cerebellum_10_right    #> 19 middle vermis 1 2       Vermis_1_2             #> 20 middle vermis 3         Vermis_3               #> 21 middle vermis 4 5       Vermis_4_5             #> 22 middle vermis 10        Vermis_10              #> 23 middle vermis 7         Vermis_7               #> 24 middle vermis 8         Vermis_8               #> 25 middle vermis 9         Vermis_9               #> 26 middle vermis 6         Vermis_6

title: AAL3 Cortical Atlas — aal3_cortical
text: Cortical parcellation AAL3 (Rolls et al. 2020) 45 regions per hemisphere. Contains 2D polygon geometry ggseg::geom_brain().

title: AAL3 Cortical Atlas — aal3_cortical
text: ggseg.formats::ggseg_atlas object (cortical).

title: AAL3 Cortical Atlas — aal3_cortical
text: Rolls, E. T., Huang, C. C., Lin, C. P., Feng, J., & Joliot, M. (2020). Automated anatomical labelling atlas 3. Neuroimage, 206, 116189. (PubMed)

title: AAL3 Subcortical (Basal Ganglia) Atlas — aal3_subcortical
text: Subcortical parcellation AAL3 (Rolls et al. 2020) covering basal ganglia thalamic nuclei 22 regions. Contains 2D polygon geometry ggseg::geom_brain() 3D meshes ggseg3d::ggseg3d().

title: AAL3 Subcortical (Basal Ganglia) Atlas — aal3_subcortical
text: ggseg.formats::ggseg_atlas object (subcortical).

title: AAL3 Subcortical (Basal Ganglia) Atlas — aal3_subcortical
text: Rolls, E. T., Huang, C. C., Lin, C. P., Feng, J., & Joliot, M. (2020). Automated anatomical labelling atlas 3. Neuroimage, 206, 116189. (PubMed)

title: AAL3 Subcortical (Basal Ganglia) Atlas — aal3_subcortical
code: aal3_subcortical() #>  #> ── aal3_subcortical ggseg atlas ──────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Type: subcortical #> Regions: 22 #> Hemispheres: left, right #> Views: coronal, axial #> Palette: ✔ #> Rendering: ✔ ggseg #> ✔ ggseg3d (meshes) #> ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> # A tibble: 43 × 3 #>    hemi  region   label          #>    <chr> <chr>    <chr>          #>  1 left  caudate  Caudate_left   #>  2 right caudate  Caudate_right  #>  3 left  putamen  Putamen_left   #>  4 right putamen  Putamen_right  #>  5 left  thal lp  Thal_LP_left   #>  6 left  thal vpl Thal_VPL_left  #>  7 right thal vpl Thal_VPL_right #>  8 left  thal il  Thal_IL_left   #>  9 right thal il  Thal_IL_right  #> 10 left  thal mdm Thal_MDm_left  #> 11 right thal mdm Thal_MDm_right #> 12 left  thal lgn Thal_LGN_left  #> 13 right thal lgn Thal_LGN_right #> 14 left  thal pum Thal_PuM_left  #> 15 right thal pum Thal_PuM_right #> 16 left  thal pua Thal_PuA_left  #> 17 right thal pua Thal_PuA_right #> 18 left  thal pul Thal_PuL_left  #> 19 right thal pul Thal_PuL_right #> 20 left  vta      VTA_left       #> 21 right vta      VTA_right      #> 22 left  sn pc    SN_pc_left     #> 23 right sn pc    SN_pc_right    #> 24 left  sn pr    SN_pr_left     #> 25 right sn pr    SN_pr_right    #> 26 left  red n    Red_N_left     #> 27 right red n    Red_N_right    #> 28 left  pallidum Pallidum_left  #> 29 right pallidum Pallidum_right #> 30 left  thal av  Thal_AV_left   #> 31 right thal av  Thal_AV_right  #> 32 left  thal va  Thal_VA_left   #> 33 right thal va  Thal_VA_right  #> 34 right thal vl  Thal_VL_right  #> 35 left  thal vl  Thal_VL_left   #> 36 left  thal mdl Thal_MDl_left  #> 37 right thal mdl Thal_MDl_right #> 38 left  thal mgn Thal_MGN_left  #> 39 right thal mgn Thal_MGN_right #> 40 left  thal pui Thal_PuI_left  #> 41 right thal pui Thal_PuI_right #> 42 left  n acc    N_Acc_left     #> 43 right n acc    N_Acc_right

what: ggsegAAL: AAL Atlases for the 'ggseg' Ecosystem — ggsegAAL-package
title: ggsegAAL: AAL Atlases for the 'ggseg' Ecosystem — ggsegAAL-package
text: AAL (Automated Anatomical Labeling) atlases 'ggseg' ecosystem. Provides unified 'ggseg_atlas' objects AAL2 (cortical, Rolls et al. 2015) AAL3 (cortical, subcortical, cerebellum, Rolls et al. 2020), 2D polygon geometry 3D vertex/mesh data use 'ggseg' 'ggseg3d'.

title: ggsegAAL: AAL Atlases for the 'ggseg' Ecosystem — ggsegAAL-package
text: Maintainer: Athanasia Mo Mowinckel .m.mowinckel@psykologi.uio.(ORCID) contributors: Herve Lemaitre herve.lemaitre@u-bordeaux.fr (ORCID) [contributor]

title: ggsegAal 2.0.0
text: aal now ggseg_atlas object (ggseg.formats) containing 2D 3D data. separate aal_3d object removed. Use ggplot() + ggseg::geom_brain(atlas = aal) 2D plots ggseg3d::ggseg3d(atlas = aal) 3D plots – object. ggseg.formats now hard dependency (Depends). Package URLs updated LCBC-UiO ggseg GitHub organisation. Atlas recreated scratch using ggsegExtra::create_cortical_atlas() bundled fsaverage5 annotation files.
